Title: Phase 1.1 – Core repo scaffolding
Body: Set up Foundry project structure for the core protocol. Establish formatting, linting, and directory conventions used by all contracts and tests.

Title: Phase 1.2 – VSP token implementation
Body: Implement ERC-20 VSP token with mint and burn functions gated by Authority roles. Include full unit test coverage.

Title: Phase 1.3 – Authority role controller
Body: Implement Authority contract with owner-controlled minter and burner roles. Ensure proper access control and tests.

Title: Phase 1.4 – Deployment scripts
Body: Create Foundry scripts for deploying VSPToken and Authority to Fuji and mainnet.

Title: Phase 2.1 – Post model and registry
Body: Implement PostRegistry with support for Claim and Link posts, including storage, creation, and getters.

Title: Phase 2.2 – Claim creation flow
Body: Add claim creation logic, validation, and retrieval in PostRegistry, with tests.

Title: Phase 2.3 – Link creation flow
Body: Implement creation of link posts connecting independent and dependent claims, including isChallenge flag.

Title: Phase 2.4 – Link graph storage
Body: Implement LinkGraph to store incoming and outgoing edges between claims with link metadata.

Title: Phase 2.5 – Enforce acyclic claim graph
Body: Prevent creation of links that would introduce cycles in the claim dependency graph. Add revert logic and tests.

Title: Phase 3.1 – Base verity score definition
Body: Define baseVS for claims and links as (support/(support+challenge))*2−1 with fixed-point scaling.

Title: Phase 3.2 – EffectiveVS formal specification
Body: Formally specify effectiveVS for claims, including recursive accumulation of upstream influence via links (Option A: positive IC influence only).

Title: Phase 3.3 – EffectiveVS implementation
Body: Implement effectiveVS calculation in ScoreEngine using recursive DAG traversal and link stake discounting.

Title: Phase 3.4 – Protocol read-only views
Body: Implement ProtocolViews contract to expose claim summaries, edges, baseVS, and effectiveVS for off-chain consumers.

Title: Phase 3.5 – Scoring gas and safety review
Body: Audit ScoreEngine recursion depth, gas usage, and add defensive limits if necessary.

Title: Phase 4.1 – Stake engine core
Body: Implement StakeEngine staking and withdrawal logic with per-post support/challenge totals.

Title: Phase 4.2 – Epoch settlement logic
Body: Implement epoch-based stake updates using effectiveVS, including neutrality at VS=0.

Title: Phase 4.3 – Mint/burn settlement integration
Body: Integrate VSP minting for gains and burning for losses during epoch settlement via Authority-controlled calls.

Title: Phase 4.4 – Invariant and fuzz testing
Body: Add invariant and fuzz tests for stake conservation, monotonicity, and edge cases across epochs.

Title: Phase 4.5 – Core security review
Body: Review core contracts for access control, reentrancy, overflow, and logic errors. Apply fixes as needed.

Title: Phase 5.1 – Backend skeleton
Body: Create backend service skeleton including configuration, environment management, and database migrations.

Title: Phase 5.2 – Chain indexer
Body: Implement indexer to ingest on-chain events (posts, links, stakes, settlements) into backend storage.

Title: Phase 5.3 – Read API
Body: Expose read-only API endpoints for claims, links, scores, and stake totals.

Title: Phase 5.4 – Transaction helpers
Body: Provide backend helpers for constructing stake, withdraw, claim, and link transactions.

Title: Phase 5.5 – Backend security and rate limiting
Body: Add authentication, rate limiting, and abuse prevention to backend APIs.

Title: Phase 6.1 – Frontend scaffold
Body: Create frontend application scaffold and build pipeline.

Title: Phase 6.2 – Claim browsing UI
Body: Implement UI for browsing claims, viewing effectiveVS, and inspecting stake breakdowns.

Title: Phase 6.3 – Claim and link creation UI
Body: Implement UI flows for publishing claims and creating support/challenge links.

Title: Phase 6.4 – Staking UI
Body: Implement UI for staking, withdrawing, and viewing epoch status.

Title: Phase 6.5 – Graph visualization
Body: Add visualization for claim dependency graph with incoming/outgoing links.

Title: Phase 7.1 – Testnet deployment
Body: Deploy full system to Fuji testnet and publish verified contract addresses.

Title: Phase 7.2 – Observability
Body: Add logging, metrics, and alerting for backend and indexer services.

Title: Phase 7.3 – Load testing
Body: Perform load testing on backend APIs and indexer throughput.

Title: Phase 7.4 – Disaster recovery planning
Body: Prepare backup, replay, and recovery procedures for production incidents.

Title: Phase 8.1 – Beta rollout
Body: Conduct limited beta rollout with selected users and collect feedback.

Title: Phase 8.2 – Mainnet readiness review
Body: Final security, economic, and operational review prior to mainnet launch.

Title: Phase 8.3 – Mainnet deployment
Body: Deploy contracts and backend to mainnet and switch production endpoints.

Title: Phase 8.4 – Production monitoring
Body: Establish on-call rotation, alert tuning, and incident response process.

Title: Phase 8.5 – Public launch
Body: Public launch announcement, documentation finalization, and support channels.
